title: Apply for a trainee driving instructor licence

details.description: Apply for a trainee driving instructor licence to help you prepare for the approved driving instructor (ADI) part 3 test
details.more_information:
It costs £140.

The online service is available from 6am to 11:30pm.

You will need:

  • your online user ID from the Driving Standards Agency (DSA)
  • your password

Finishing your application

To finish your application you will need to send:

  • a print out of the last screen
  • a passport-sized photo with your ADI personal reference number on the back
  • the ‘instructor training declaration’ form to prove you have done 40 hours of training
  • the ‘application for trainee licence: declaration of manager/owner’ form if it’s your first trainee licence

Download ‘ADI 21T - Instruction training declaration’ form (PDF, 217KB)

Download ‘ADI 3L(MD) - Application for trainee licence: declaration of manager/owner’ form (PDF, 240KB)

There’s a different process to apply for a trainee licence in Northern Ireland.
details.introduction: Apply for a trainee licence to give driving lessons - you’ll need to have passed the approved driving instructor (ADI) part 2 test and have done at least 40 hours of training with a qualified ADI.
details.alternate_methods:
Apply by post

To apply for a trainee licence by post, download the application form and send it to DSA.

You’ll also need to send:

  • a passport-sized photo with your ADI personal reference number on the back
  • the ‘instructor training declaration’ form to prove you have done 40 hours of training
  • the ‘application for trainee licence: declaration of manager/owner’ form if it’s your first trainee licence

Download ‘ADI 3L - Application for trainee licence’ (PDF, 366KB)

Download ‘ADI 21T - Instruction training declaration’ (PDF, 217KB)

Download ‘ADI 3L(MD) - Application for trainee licence: declaration of manager/owner’ (PDF, 240KB)
